title: SS.PT.383
prompt: Why might the early archaeologists' data have been misleading?
description: The passage describes the possible causes of a fire that occured around the 7th or 8th century.
feedback: All of the sites that early archaeologists excavated showed damage from fire, but these early archaeologists only excavated areas used by the elite upper class. They determined that the whole city was burned, but they only looked at the wealthy areas. The controversy arose when poorer parts of the city were excavated and found unburned. Early archaeologists missed this because they examined only the wealthy areas of the city.
